intro: Oxyspora, commonly known as the "spear thistle," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its spiny leaves and yellow or purple flower heads. The plant is native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere, including parts of Europe, Asia, and North America. Oxyspora species often grow in disturbed soils and can be found in meadows, roadsides, and waste areas. Its botanical features make it an important plant in ecological studies and traditional herbal medicine.
